lines.text: Shut up. That's your business. Look, I don't care if you're half monkey or half ape, I'm gettin' you out of here.
[last lines]

[voiceover]
Dear Lana, By the time you read this, I'll be back home in Lincoln. I'm scared of what's ahead, but when I think of you I know I'll be able to go on. You were right. Memphis isn't far at all. I'll be making a trip out on the highway before too long. I'll be waiting for ya. Love always and forever, Brandon.
You don't seem like you're from around here.
Where... where do I seem like I'm from?
Someplace... beautiful.
So what's your name?

[laughs]
Candace. I hate it though. I'm thinking of changing it.
Sometimes that helps. I'm Brandon.
What were you like... before all this? Were you like me, like a GIRL girl?
Yeah... like a long time ago... but then I guess I was just like a boy girl, then I was just a jerk.
Boy, I... I really fucked up. I borrowed one of Candace's checks, then I got that speeding ticket, and this fake I.D. I guess, I just need to learn to stay home, huh?
Brandon, I invite you into my home and you expose my daughter to your sickness. D'ever think about Lana in all this?
That's all I been thinking about.
[John and Tom have pulled Brandon's pants down to show Lana that her boyfriend is biologically female, but Lana refuses to acknowledge it]
Leave him alone!
HIM? HIM?
God, I hate my life.

[drunk on the sofa]
Lana?
I hate your life, too.
Why do you go hanging out with guys, you being a girl yourself? Why do you go around kissing every girl?
I... don't see what this has to do with what had happened.
I'm asking you all these so that when I speak to the jury, they're going to want some answers, so I have to know exactly what is going on. Now, are you going to answer my question or not?
I... have a sexual identity crisis.
You have a what?
I have a sexual identity crisis.

[about John]
Doctors say he got no impulse control. I'm the only one who can control that fucker.
No.
Why not? You're beautiful.
Come over here.

[to Brandon]
Who are you?
I don't want IT in my house.

[to himself, laughing]
I'm an asshole.
Miss Brandon? Miss Brandon, we ran your Charles Behrman ID through to the computer, and this is what the Lincoln authorities faxed us over. You tell me.
Wow... This Teena chick's pretty messed up.

[on Lana]
I'm going to ask her to marry me.
Before or after your sex-change operation? Before or after you tell her you're a girl?
Shut up!
Lana, you are one cranky girl.

Yeah, well, you'd be cranky, too, Mister I'm Going To Memphis Graceland Tennessee, if you were stuck in a town where there's nothing to do but go bumper skiing and chase bats every night of your evil fucking life.
Shut up, you fucking pervert. Are you a girl or are you not? ARE YOU A GIRL OR ARE YOU NOT?
There's an easy way to fix this problem.
Fuck you! You stay the fuck away from me!
Oh, you wanna fight?
I mean, you don't have to be sober to weigh spinach.
Think they'd recognize her if we chopped off her head and her hands?
